text: It's like gambling somehow. You go out for a night of drinking and you don't know where you're going to end up the next day. It could work out good or it could be disastrous. It's like the throw of the dice.

text: Love cannot save you from your own fate.

text: Expose yourself to your deepest fear; after that, fear has no power, and the fear of freedom shrinks and vanishes. You are free.

text: Pain is meant to wake us up. People try to hide their pain. But they're wrong. Pain is something to carry, like a radio. You feel your strength in the experience of pain.

text: A hero is someone who rebels or seems to rebel against the facts of existence and seems to conquer them...

text: We fear violence less than our own feelings. Personal, private, solitary pain is more terrifying than what anyone else can inflict.

text: Violence isn't always evil. What's evil is the infatuation with violence.

text: The most loving parents and relatives commit murder with smiles on their faces. They force us to destroy the person we really are: a subtle kind of murder.

text: There can't be any large-scale revolution until there's a personal revolution, on an individual level. It's got to happen inside first.
